title: Lucia Herrero
text:
Interests
Neurodevelopment of emotion regulation, intergenerational psychopathology risk, sociocultural resilience, Latine mental health


Publications
Psychology
McCrea, C. E. & Herrero, L. Social exclusion fails to induce distress-related depletion during food choice. [Manuscript in Review]. Department of Psychological Sciences, Boise State University.
Herrero, L., & McCrea, C. E. (2023). Hunger modulates perceptions of food health but not taste in restricted eaters. Frontiers in psychology, 14, 1212778.
Other
Farke, A. A., & Herrero, L. (2014). Variation in the skull roof of the hadrosaur Gryposaurus illustrated by a new specimen from the Kaiparowits Formation (late Campanian) of southern Utah. In Hadrosaurs (pp. 191–199). Indiana University Press.
Herrero, L., & Farke, A. A. (2010). Hadrosaurid dinosaur skin impressions from the Upper Cretaceous Kaiparowits Formation of southern Utah, USA. PalArch’s Journal of Vertebrate Palaeontology, 7(2), 1–7.]

title: Lucia Herrero
text:
I am an NIMH Diversity Supplement Scholar using a multi-method approach to investigate the neurodevelopment of emotion regulation. Particularly, I am interested in understanding how environmental, intergenerational, and sociocultural risk and protective factors influence emotion regulation development.


The Pennsylvania State University
Doctoral Candidate in Developmental Psychology and Social and Behavioral Neuroscience | Anticipated 2029
Stanford University
Bachelor of Arts in Archaeology | 2015



Cognition, Affect, and Temperament Lab
PI: Koraly Pérez-Edgar, Ph.D. | Fall 2023 - Present
Healthy Brain and Child Development (U01 DA055361)
EEG & MRI Data Collection

Parent Child Anxiety Transmission (R01 MH130007)
Disruptive Behavior: Diagnostic Observation Schedule (DB:DOS) Behavioral Coding
